text: [Music]
two weeks ahead I sit down with a text
of the passage of the Bible I'm going to
preach on and I spent about four hours
figuring out what I think the U the
outline of that text is the meaning of
the text I need to look up what the
commentators think about maybe
problematic vers
and I come up with an outline and a u a
basic a basic you might say an ex aesus
or an exposition of the the the passage
itself I write this up and I send it to
my musicians who are going to be um uh
putting it in the bulletin you know
they're going to be choosing music for
it uh I send it to other preachers who
some some of whom are going to be
preaching sermons on the same
text uh then the three days before I sit
down with this outline and I spent
another four hours turning the Bible
study into a sermon and they're not the
same thing the Bible study is more
abstract what does the text say the
sermon is more life related what does
this mean to me so I spend four hours
two weeks ahead on the text I spend four
hours turning it into a um um a life
related sermon and that's usually on the
Friday before and then on Saturday I
spent another six hours on it uh just
trying to make it shorter because it's
always too long unless I make it shorter
make it shorter make it shorter make it
shorter so I spent about 14 to 16 hours
a week writing a sermon then I spend all
day preaching it because I speak four
times on a Sunday and so I actually put
in about 25 hours a week into producing
and delivering one public uh speaking
presentation before I do anything else
in my
job
